An ultrasound at that time showed gallstones . She was okay until February , 2003 , when she began feeling nauseated , and having recurrent attacks of pain . She was recently without pain , but was worried about having future pain , therefore , planned to have laparoscopic cholecystectomy . She denies any fever and chills or weight loss . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Left breast biopsy in the 1960 's ; Dilate and curettage in 1955 ; Occasional angina , relief with nitroglycerin . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was admitted on the same date of surgery , on 05/26/03 . She underwent laparoscopic cholecystectomy without any complications . She was given one dose of perioperative Ampicillin for her mitral regurgitation . She was getting intramuscular Morphine for pain . She was beginning to take sips of clear fluid , and later that evening , she was increasing her PO intake , and she was able to void on her own , and ambulate with assistance , and by the next day , she was doing quite well , and , therefore , it was decided she could be discharged in stable condition , on 05/27/03 .
